info.description: Retrieve, update, and create configurations which drive Risk Governance behaviours and Risk Radar UI choices.
info.title: Risk Governance - Configuration

get.description:
Retrieve a list of configurations matching the specified filter criteria. 
Based on https://google.aip.dev/160 , this operation provides a flexible way to filter records. This complements the bulk retrieval operation which filters specifically using the configuration records natural unique identifiers.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description: Used to provide with https://google.aip.dev/160 filtering capabilities.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous `ListRiskConfig` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to `ListRiskConfig` must match
the call that provided the page token.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description:
The number of entries to be returned as a response. The service may return fewer
than this value. The maximum value is 1000. If unspecified, at most 1000 entries will be returned.
parameters.name: pageSize

post.description:
Retrieve a large number of configuration records in bulk by specifically filtering on the configuration's natural unique identifiers. This operation is designed to complement the more flexible filtering capabilities supported by the List operation 
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9016::query-custom-method-http=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it is an existing api changing existing URI to suggested URI will break all citizen developers code. --)

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

RiskConfigConfigEntityType.description:
- CONFIG_ENTITY_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: DEFAULT unspecified config type
 - CONFIG_ENTITY_TYPE_MASTER: Default entity type, global configuration
 - CONFIG_ENTITY_TYPE_RULE: Rule based configuration overriride
 - CONFIG_ENTITY_TYPE_EVALUATOR: Evaluator  based configuration overriride
 - CONFIG_ENTITY_TYPE_PORTFOLIO: Portfolio specific override
 - CONFIG_ENTITY_TYPE_REFERENCE: REFERENCE type list
RiskConfigConfigEntityType.title: Allowed entity type for the configuration

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

typesAnalyticDataValue.title: Wrapper for security analytic value which could be one of many data types

valueString.title: This field stores the data when it's in string data type

valueNumeric.title: This field stores the data when it's in a numeric data type

valueInteger.title: This field stores the data when it's in a integer data type

valueDate.title: This field stores the data when it's in date data type

v1ConfigRecord.title:
Supported configuration record, it can only have single type of configuration
This will evolve overtime and we will add more structured configuration record 
To start with we have  DisplayConfigNode and one google provided generic sturcture

genericConfigRecord.title:
This is generic config record, Should not be used regularly
It will be replaced with more specific structure going further

displayConfigRecord.title: This is used to hold display type of configuration

displayValueList.title: This is the display value list which holds display value for the reference config records

referenceConfigRecord.title: This config record will be have reference to other configs

resolvedReferenceConfigRecord.title:
This field will be populated with resolved nodes corresponds to reference config record
This will be populated only for resolve end point

customMetricConfigRecord.title: This is custom evaluation metric config

metric.title: Name of the custom evaluation metric

displayName.title: Name of the custom evaluation metric to be displayed

summary.title: Description for the custom evaluation metric

active.title: Ensures if this config to be used further, setting it to false will not allow to create new Risk Rule for this conig

displayFormat.title: Display format to be used by UI

customMetricConfigs.title: List of custom evaluation metric metadata

v1DisplayConfigNode.title: Config value element, which can have child nodes optional. and display value

displayValue.title: Display value which will be used on UI to render data

riskConfigNodes.title: Child node for the config data to create tree structure configuration

v1DisplayValueRecord.title: This has display value to be referenced by reference config nodes

displayValue.title: Display value which will be used on UI to render data

active.title: Ensures if this value is relevant

v1DisplayValueRecordList.title: This holds display value for the reference config records

displayValues.title: This contains key and display value record

navigation.title: Links used to navigate through the available entries matching the specified criteria found at the repository

riskConfigs.title: A list of RiskConfig entities that satisfied the request criteria

count.title: The number of entries returned with the current response

total.title:
The number of records matching the specified criterias at the repository
Deprecated - use total_size instead

nextPageToken.description:
A token that can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

totalSize.title: The number of entries matching the specified criterias at the repository

v1ListRiskConfigRevisionsResponse.title:
response message of a version request
(-- api-linter: core::0158::response-next-page-token-field=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it is unecessary for the current scope. --)

riskConfigs.title: A list of RiskConfig entities that satisfied the request criteria

v1MetricValueType.description:
- METRIC_VALUE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: value of custom evaluation metric type is not specefied
 - METRIC_VALUE_TYPE_DOUBLE: value of custom evaluation metric type is decimal
 - METRIC_VALUE_TYPE_INTEGER: value of custom evaluation metric type is whole number
v1MetricValueType.title: Possible value for metric type

v1ReferenceConfigRecord.title: This wil contain reference to other config

referenceConfigType.title: config type which will be referenced

displayOrder.title: Display order for this display node

referenceConfigNodes.title: Child node for the config data to create tree structure configuration

navigation.title: Links used to navigate through the available entries matching the specified criteria found at the repository

riskConfigs.title: A list of RiskConfig entities that satisfied the request criteria

count.title: The number of entries returned with the current response

total.title:
The number of records matching the specified criterias at the repository
Deprecated - use total_size instead

nextPageToken.description:
A token that can be sent as `pageToken` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

totalSize.title: The number of entries matching the specified criterias at the repository

v1ResolvedReferenceConfigRecord.title:
Resolve Config value corresponds to reference config element, 
which has resolved display value and child nodes if any

displayValueRecord.title: Display value which will be used on UI to render data

resolvedConfigNodes.title: Child node for the config data to create tree structure configuration

riskConfigs.title: List of RiskConfig matching the specified exception ids

v1RetrieveRiskConfigRequestCompoundKey.title: The request message compound keys for RiskConfigAPI.RetrieveRiskConfig

retrieveRiskConfigRequestCompoundKeyItem.title: The request message items for RiskConfigAPI.RetrieveRiskConfig compound keys

v1RetrieveRiskConfigRequestCompoundKeyIt.title: The request message item for RiskConfigAPI.RetrieveRiskConfig compound keys

configType.title:
Configuration record type for the record e.g. CLOSE_OUT_REASON
the value will be user given and will be unique for a given configuration family

configEntityType.title: Allowed entity type for the configuration

configEntityIds.title: The ID of the entity that this configuration record is concerned with

v1RetrieveRiskConfigRequestConfigId.title: The request message carring config ids for RiskConfigAPI.RetrieveRiskConfig

configIds.title: A list of the target config ids

configType.title:
Configuration record type for the record e.g. CLOSE_OUT_REASON
the value will be user given and will be unique for a given configuration family

revisionId.title: Unique revision for the configuration record,

modificationAuthor.title: Author of the this configuration record

entryTime.title: The timestamp at which this record is entered into the repository

expiryTime.title: The timestamp at which this record is expired (due to new version of the record created)

configEntityType.title:
Default entity is "MASTER" and entity id is "1" for a single config type.
Further it can be Rule, Evaluator (technical) or 
Issuer, Asset(business) level override in case required for a given config type
Used to determine the type of the entityId field e.g Rule, Evaluator etc

configEntityId.title: The ID of the entity that this configuration record is concerned with

v1RiskNavigationLinks.description: Class to carry the links to be used when navigating across the data matched by a given criteria.

self.title: Link to the current set of data

first.title: Link to the first chunk of data matching the given criteria

previous.title: Link to the previuos chunk of data matching the given criteria

next.title: Link to the next chunk of data matching the given criteria

last.title: Latest chunk of chunk of data matching the given criteria

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
